value.title: Germany Extends Travel Warning Until June to Curb Coronavirus Spread
value.excerpt: Germany is extending its international travel advisory until at least mid June in an effort to curb the worldwide spread of the coronavirus. Heiko Mass, Germany's foreign minister, announced on Wednesday that the country's travel warning for unnecessary international tourism travel will be extended until at least June 14.

value.title: IOC official disagrees coronavirus vaccine needed for Tokyo Olympics

value.title: Coronavirus: Boeing to cut 15,000 jobs in Covid-19 'body blow'
value.excerpt: Boeing will cut 10% of its workforce. It said the Covid-19 pandemic had delivered it a "body blow". The struggling US plane maker employs 150,000 people worldwide and was already under pressure after being forced to ground its 737 Max planes following two fatal crashes.

value.title: 40% of coronavirus deaths in Texas linked to nursing homes, assisted living centers
